author: brane
msg: Some filesystem and repos tests were failing in the Win32 Release build
because the expected trees (and possibly script commands) were allocated
on the stack, and the compiler decided to reuse the same stack slots
* subversion/tests/libsvn_fs/fs-test.c: Make all trees and scripts static.

author: cmpilato
msg: Fix some stuff in the aftermath of the Greg Stein Review of 2002.

author: cmpilato
msg: Fix some serious memory issues in import and commit.
(import_file): Add new imported_file structure to the hash instead
of just the file baton.  Also, do all file-related work inside a
(import): Do file work in the subpool associated with the file
itself, and destroy that subpool after the file has been processed.
(svn_client_commit): Use a per-iteration subpool for doing
(do_item_commit): Make 'file_mods' an apr_hash_t * instead of an
apr_array_header_t *, and do some things a little differently in
accordance with that change, including allocating file batons in
(svn_client__do_commit): Bug fix (forgot to close the file baton!)
and new use of the file_mods hash.

author: kfogel
msg: (rep_lines_res): Replace out the part of the string that varies
between release builds and dev builds.  Add explanatory comment.
See this thread on the dev list for more about this change:
Subject:  Re: rMacOS X: Test failure with r1682+
